nodes.bodyText: question: is this client communicating with the local agent only?
No, when we direct the server URI then this communicates with the Consul server. There is a no different way of communicating with the local agent or server.

Oop! I forgot that response is a future.
Ok.

How about checking whether consulUri is null and throwing an exception if it is?
Or we can remove the ConsulClient setter which is only used in test and accept the uri in the constructor so that consulUri is not null.
Question: Only id is not null?

I refactored the inner class Service for our use case.

make a constructor
remove unused properties
make all fields not null except the check.
Can we make AgentServiceClient once in the constructor and reuse it?
Ok, so I changed to use the builder.
Can we make CatalogClient  once in the constructor and reuse it?
Ok, and then I removed a related trivial test.

How about removing this method?
I think ConsulEndpontGroup and ConsulUpdatingListener can have the URI when they are built.
I refactored ConsulEndpointGroup, ConsulUpdatingListener, and their builders also. So please review again whether to have their own URI.

Change the modifier to public and move the documentation here?
Javadoc is inherited.

Programatically build looks good. However, some users might want to load a Consul URI from their configuration files such as yml or properties and create this builder the URI string.
Don't we need to offer consulUri(String) and consulUri(URI)? 🤔
Maybe there is a use case for that. If so I think the API version string is not included in the URI. What is your opinion?
How about mentioning the Consul URI spec that should contain an API version in the Javadoc?

                 * The URI should include the Consul API version at path, like: {@code /v1}

                 * @param consulUri the URI of Consul API service, default: http://127.0.0.1:8500/v1
Could we raise IllegalArgumentException if consulUri contains an empty or null path?

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * @param consulApiVersion the version of Consul API service, default: v1
          
          
            
                 * @param consulApiVersion the version of Consul API service, default: {@code v1}

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * @param consulToken the token for accessing Consul API, default: null
          
          
            
                 * @param consulToken the token for accessing Consul API, default: {@code null}
Could be removed the duplicate he interval between fetching registry requests.?

This function could be a static method. Could you make this function static?
For example:
private static Endpoint convertToEndpoint(Node node) {
    ...
}

...
nodes.stream().map(CatalogClient::convertToEndpoint)
How about prepending '/' only if consulApiVersion does not start with /?
I added a checkArgument() at consulApiVersion() to prevent this.

Please take a look.

Sorry for the late review. 🙏



Please take a look.

Sorry for the late review. 🙏

Not at all.
Could you move these methods overridden only return type to the bottom of this class?
Could you move these methods overridden only return type to the bottom of this class?
How about: a local Consul agent at the default Consul service port.?
Could we keep the interval in milliseconds internally? A user may want to check service health at sub-second frequency.
Is there any reason why we are not using milliseconds here? It looks to me like we have control over the granularity of the interval.

Actually, this is my work. EurekaEndpointGroupBuilder takes the refresh interval as seconds precision. I'm not strong here and just followed the Eureka convension. :-)

  
    
      armeria/eureka/src/main/java/com/linecorp/armeria/client/eureka/EurekaEndpointGroupBuilder.java
    
    
         Line 205
      in
      e872d75
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public EurekaEndpointGroupBuilder registryFetchIntervalSeconds(long registryFetchIntervalSeconds) {

HealthCheckedEndpointGroup actually has retryIntervalMillis().. Perhaps we should deprecate one of them and use a unified unit? I'm slightly leaning towards milliseconds. Let me send a PR for EurekaEndpointGroup.
How about replacing the default value (/v1) in Javadoc with v1 for reducing confusion.
How about checking using a regular expression? e.g. ^v[0-9][-._a-zA-Z0-9]*$
Make sure ... by Consul before enabling this feature.
Please move this method after all chaining methods for consistency with other builder classes.

Sorry, I missed the default values defined in this class.
Could we use {@value ...} expression where possible. e.g. {@value #DEFAULT_CONSUL_ADDRESS}
Ditto - please make sure we do URI encoding for all path components.
Is there any smarter way to apply the encoding? URLEncoder.encode(path, "UTF-8") is a bit cumbersome.
Could use HttpHeaderNames.of("x-consul-token") instead. Should keep it as a static final field.
Could we add a test if we did not yet?

Done!
Now we use the token for the tests by default except testing 403.
Could prepend ? here so we don't have to later.
.name() because toString() is for human-friendly representation?
Yes, I changed to else if structure.
Do you think it's a good idea to remove all these methods in favor of consulUri? Consul agent seems to run at localhost in most cases, so I guess these methods will not be used very often.

Does that mean it would be better to remove the alternative methods except for consul Uri?
These methods are designed for such cases, but if they are verbose we can safely delete them. However, it may be confusing to users regarding the version. Most users will not be interested in the API version. Would it be better to leave only the URI and version?

Nonetheless, I think it wouldn't be bad to leave it as it is. Because in many cases we will only change the port or protocol, like this:
ConsulEndpointGroup endpointGroup =
                     ConsulEndpointGroup.builder(SERVICE_NAME)
                                        .consulPort(CONSUL_AGENT_PORT)
                                        .consulToken(TOKEN)
                                        .build();
How about inlining a hard-coded string? i.e. path.append("?passing=true")

nodes.bodyText: What is the correct name of Consul token, just 'token', 'access token' or 'acl token'?
Definitely, it may mean 'Consul ACL token', but hashicorp seems to use the three as synonyms: 'Consul token', 'ACL token', and just 'token'. There is no other meaning of token.
The constant will be changed to CONSUL_TOKEN.
Ah, OK. Then fine with consulToken.
"consulApiVersion: %s (expected: a version string that starts with 'v', e.g. 'v1')", consulVersion

RESTful and HTTP mean the same thing in this context so I think we can just use the word in the web site that is
Consul's HTTP API

I think we need a setter for the endpoint selection strategy.
https://github.com/line/armeria/blob/master/eureka/src/main/java/com/linecorp/armeria/client/eureka/EurekaEndpointGroupBuilder.java#L101

You can copy from here: 
  
    
      armeria/core/src/main/java/com/linecorp/armeria/client/endpoint/dns/DnsEndpointGroupBuilder.java
    
    
         Line 173
      in
      c7edfb6
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public DnsEndpointGroupBuilder selectionStrategy(EndpointSelectionStrategy selectionStrategy) {

How about passing (URI)or (Strig uri) when creating this class and removing
consulUri(URI consulUri),
consulUri(String consulUri),
consulProtocol,
consulAddress,
consulPort,
consulAddress?
If we do that, we can remove the complex setting logic and simplify the uri setting.
We have discussed this above. I think that your opinion also is not bad. Shall I change it? As you said, the version seems to have to be separated.

Ah, I missed that. 😄
I think if we just use the constructor which takes Strig consulUri that will greatly simplify the builder API. And also it will be consistent with the Eureka API.
So I prefer to use String consulUri but not super strong on it. So it's up to you. 😄

If serviceAddress and address are both null, I think we should return null (don't forget to mark @Nullable) and filter where this is called.
.filter(Objects::nonNull)
Well, we prefer to use @Nullable instead of Optional for the API. So let's use just @Nullable for consistency. 🙇
Fixed and renamed to toEndpoint()for consistency.
I guess you forgot to push your commit 😉
I see. I didn't finish my homework.

I think we can use byte[]
return mapper.readValue(response.content().array(), collectionTypeForNode);
Does it make sense to use HttpMethod.HEAD as the default?
Yes, it makes sense. I tested this and applied it.

We should not mention a class in an internal package because we hide them all.

nodes.bodyText: How about removing public if the test runs without it?
How about removing public if it's not necessary?
Could be protected rather than public?
It can't be 'protected'. Otherwise, we have to make an empty public constructor.
